result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandon A Webber was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
*Court ordered defendant pay all mandatory costs, fees and surcharges (including DNA surcharge) by June 14, 2016. Failure to pay will result in an immediate entry of a civil judgment.
*Court ordered defendant provide DNA sample after today's proceedings.
Concurrent with: With credit for 2 (two) days, a TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brandon A Webber

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Received and Filed Notice of Right to Seek postconviction Relief.
Scanned: State Subpoena.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

AS TO COUNT 1:

Court sentences defendant to serve 2 days in the House of Correction concurrent with credit for 2 (two) days, a TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

Court ordered defendant pay all mandatory costs, fees and surcharges (including DNA surcharge) by June 14, 2016. Failure to pay will result in an immediate entry of a civil judgment.

Court ordered defendant provide DNA sample after today's proceedings. 

-20 day appeal given,

-Pretrial Incarceration Credit; received and filed.

ADDRESS INFO for Brandon A Webber
Current: 1451 S. 81st Street, West Allis, WI 53214   (Effective: 12-14-2015)
Prior: 2315 West Oklahoma Avenue, Milwaukee, WI 53215

Defendant Brandon A Webber in court with attorney Ann M Heaps.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for jury trial.

AS TO COUNT 1:

Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the criminal complaint and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.
Justice Point Program report dated December 11, 2015; received and filed.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.
-From Attorney Ann Heaps on behalf of her client; Received and filed.    Deputy Court Clerk: TC.
-Defendant's Proposed Jury Instructions; received and filed.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.
-Motion To Suppress Statements from Attorney Heaps on behalf of her client; received and filed.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

Defendant Brandon A Webber in court with attorney Ann M Heaps.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC.   Final pre-trial conference held. Case remains calendared for jury trial on December 14, 2015 at 9:00 a.m., Branch 31.  All parties are notified that effective 12-01-15 this case will be assigned to Reserved Branch, Branch 31, in Room 615 of the Courthouse.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report dated November 13, 2015; received and filed.

Defendant Brandon A Webber in court with attorney Anne M Jaspers.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for projected guilty plea and sentencing. Defense counsel requests jury trial date.  

Any and all motions are to be filed with the court by the final pretrial date. Case is adjourned for Final Pretrial Conference and Jury Trial, Branch 37.  Final pre-trial scheduled for November 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for December 14, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Justice Point Program report dated September 3, 2015; received and filed.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Violation Report (missed telephone contact) received and filed. Court will not take any action.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Brandon A Webber in court with attorney Anne M Jaspers.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Agreed Upon Request for A New Court Date received and filed with court.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with: Genaro M.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Brandon A Webber in court with attorney Anne M Jaspers.  Defendant Brandon A Webber in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
